Do you want help to configure and know how to use this application?

- Go to "Settings" using start screen's top right menu.
 - Click on "Local browsing".
 - Switch on "Local files".
 - Click on "Add a root directory"
 - Click on the added line then browse and select a directory.
 
 You can now browse this directory by clicking on the car on the start screen.
 
 You can configure up to 3 directories in case you'd have several storage device and / or video directories.
 You can remove a directory by clicking the red cross.

- Go to "Settings" using start screen's top right menu.
 - Click on "UPnP/DLNA browsing".
 - Switch on "UPnP/DLNA".
 - Click on "Add a UPnP/DLNA server"
 - Click on the added line then browse and select a directory.
 
 You can now browse this directory by clicking on the car on the start screen.
 
 You can configure up to 3 servers but you can access only one at a time. The application will connect to the first available server.
 You can remove a server by clicking the red cross.
Copy a file from UPnP server to local directory

- Go to "Parent mode" using start screen's top right menu.
 - Browse UPnP files until you reach the one you want to copy.
 - Long press the file.
 - In the new pop-up select "Copy to local".
 - In the new pop_up select the destination then click "Yes".
 - The file is downloaded. You'll find it in the destination directory with the same path as on the server.

To configure the directory where thumbnails will be saved: - Go to "Settings" using start screen's top right menu.
 - Click on "General".
 - Click on "Thumbnails" then browse and select a directory.
 
 To find and assign a thumbnail to a file or a directory: 
 - Go to "Parent mode" using start screen's top right menu.
 - Browse local or UPnP files until you reach the one you want to assign a new thumbnail.
 - Long press the file.
 - In the new pop-up select "Search for a thumbnail".
 - On the new screen click the thumbnail you want to use.
Delete a local file or directory

- Go to "Parent mode" using top right menu.
 - Browse local files until you reach the one you want to copy.
 - Long press the file.
 - In the new pop-up select "Delete".
 - In the new pop_up click "Yes".
 
 To delete a directory you have to delete all the contained files first.

Parent mode is a mode where more actions are possible. It can only be activated from the start screen. When turned on, the application title bar will be red. Once turned on the application stays in this state until the parent mode is turned off.\n \n To turn on or off parent mode, click "Parent mode" in the start screen\'s top right menu.
